title: Unemployment rate in Scotland 2000 to 2019
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Unemployment rate. In total the number of data points it has is 20.
Overall Unemployment rate has decreased over the Year.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year 2008 and 2009.
The highest Unemployment rate, of value 8.2 was reached at Year 2010
The lowest Unemployment rate, of value 3.6 was reported at Year 2019
